title: @Meddler Poppy :<?
body:
I've seen on a post that you said she might get changed into a tank !
Will she still be a little yordle or a super-big-Sion-looking-evil creature ? '^'

replies.body: Still a Yordle sized Yordle that smacks people much bigger than herself around. She's quite a long way off though, you'll end up seeing a range of other reworks first.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=69fyI52O,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-07-18T07:59:02.881+0000)
>
> Still a Yordle sized Yordle that smacks people much bigger than herself around. She's quite a long way off though, you'll end up seeing a range of other reworks first.

You have no clue on how deep this cuts me to my core(as someone who has literally been waiting over a year if not two for her rework. Which is always, seemly around the corner...)

Just a few questions, why is is it taking so long? Is she complex? Is she just bottom of the list of priorities? At this point is it really worth it? Do you even care about this champ? I hate to be so in your face about it, but either tell us the approximate date or just scrape the damn thing. Its not fair to us who love this champ so much, or to the champ herself...

> [{quoted}](name=TyberAce,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=69fyI52O,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2015-07-18T11:41:33.308+0000)

> Just a few questions, why is is it taking so long? Is she complex? Is she just bottom of the list of priorities? At this point is it really worth it? Do you even care about this champ? I hate to be so in your face about it, but either tell us the approximate date or just scrape the damn thing. Its not fair to us who love this champ so much, or to the champ herself...

Pretty sure her rework is about Sion's level, so probably her rework will be done estimatingly on 2 or 3 years like how Sion's was.

I wouldn't expect Poppy's rework to take as long as Sion's rework was though.

Sion had problems from a visual standpoint in addition to a gameplay standpoint, while Poppy doesn't have as much, if any, visual problems.
Can you elaborate on where you guys are in her rework and what's holding her back?  Is she not a priority in the pipeline ATM?

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=69fyI52O,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-07-18T07:59:02.881+0000)
>
> Still a Yordle sized Yordle that smacks people much bigger than herself around. She's quite a long way off though, you'll end up seeing a range of other reworks first.

I know that I'm beating a dead horse.  However, since Poppy's rework needs to finish before work can begin on the other champions that needs similar level reworks (Urgot, Yorick), just how long are we expected to wait for ChampUp to "get things right" with everyone?

If Poppy is still "quite a long way off," what does that mean for fans of Yorick and Urgot?  We've **already waited more than 4 years** for a new Yorick skin, or any significant development with the champ from Riot.  Are we going to have to wait another **two to three years** before Riot gets around to doing something about Yorick, a champion the company acknowledges needs some major love?

Like Shen perhaps? :]

LCS needs their tanky ninja to perform!

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=69fyI52O,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-07-18T07:59:02.881+0000)
>
> Still a Yordle sized Yordle that smacks people much bigger than herself around. She's quite a long way off though, you'll end up seeing a range of other reworks first.

Then how comes she's on the "actively being worked on" part of the Rework section?  Shouldn't that mean that she's next in line?

I know that the rework departments are wacky at Riot and constantly fluctuating, but why bother just listing Poppy then?  If you are saying right here, right now, that a slew of other reworks are going to be released before her, then the Rework page should reflect that.  You should be showing Taric, and Evelynn and all the other champions that are undergoing reworks.

AFAIK champion reworks don't occur linearly; it's not quite an assembly line. (Note: The following is all hypothetical) Her gameplay might be good to go but her visuals are still being worked on, or visuals might be done but her lore/launch materials (ie. any videos, reveals, teasers) might not be finished, or any combination of all the factors that go into creating a champion. In addition, if gameplay is done with Poppy, and say, Ashe just needs a gameplay touch up, they can work on her and release her as soon as she finishes, since she didn't need (much) visual work or (any) lore, etc.

I *think* the reason they listed her was because she's (or at least was at the time) the next major focus as far as champion relaunches. I wouldn't be surprised if they did away with the reworks page though, just because things seem to fluctuate a lot (apparently Fiora's rework is up again?)
But her rework was announced 8 months ago. D:

Is th Champion Update Schedule page going to be...updated?! We know about {{champion:21}} and {{champion:41}} now. So will we see more information on OTHER champions please?! {{champion:44}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:78}} {{champion:19}} {{champion:83}} {{champion:133}}
ah man thats why i just walked away from this game, another staffer with the copy past statement  that says " Big punch in a small package"

She'll be a Yordle-sized champion with a hammer the size of Sion's axe. One of her abilities will be to swing the hammer, and then get unwillingly pulled along in that direction as a gapcloser while a "whoa-whoa-WHOA" sound effect plays. She'll also have a special joke with Trynd talking about how she understands his troubles with having one arm be stronger than the other.

Source: Rito

She's definitely still gonna be a yordle, one of the announcements said they wanted to keep her identity as the girl-with-a-hammer-bigger-than-her-body. Or something.
